p: Family confinement may be a trigger for intrafamilial violence during the COVID-19 pandemic. Several countries, such as France and Brazil have reported an increase in reported cases of domestic violence; children are more at risk of abuse or neglect when they live in a home where domestic violence occurs ( Campbell, 2020). During this period, women and girls are reportedly more exposed to gender-based violence, including sexual violence ( UNFPA, 2020). Although data is scarce, it can be assumed that adolescents, particularly adolescent girls, are a population at risk of enduring violence during this crisis. In the context of lockdown, and school closures, adolescents escape the vigilance of professionals or other adults who would have spotted their distress in normal social conditions.
